page.title: 13A FARMERS DAY
page.content: A FARMERS DAY STARTS AT 6.00AM.AT THAT TIME HE MILKS THE COWS AND AT 9.00 HE EATS HIS BREAKFAST.AFTER 9.00 HE WORKS ON THE LAND BUT AT 4.00 HE MILKS THE COWS AGAIN.ON HIS FARM THERE ARE 2 CATS(RATTERS),1 AYRSHIRE BULL,1 HEREFORD BULL,220 AYRSHIRE COWS,140 HENS,GUINEAFOWL,AND CHICKENS.THE COWS ARE NUMBERED AND NAMED.HE ALSO HAS 300 ACRES OF LAND. 130 ARE CORN, 40 ARE WINTER WHEAT,20 ARE BARLEY AND THE REST ARE SPRING BARLEY.THE TRANSPORT ON THE FARM INCLUDES 2 TRACTORS,1 J.C.B., 1 HAYKICKER, AND 1 HAY BALER. IT TAKES SEVERAL HOURS TO BALE A FIELD AND YOU CAN ONLY DO THIS JOB IF IT IS SUNNY. SITUATED ON THIS FARM IS THE SITE OF A NORMAN HILL FORT. IN THE MIDDLE OF THE SITE IS A VERY DEEP WELL AND AROUND THE OUTSIDE IS A DRY MOAT.YOU CAN SEE CLEARLY THE RAISED MOUND OR 'MOTTE'.
